item.title: Topcoder
item.dc:creator: yannpaul
item.description:
I've only recently came across `topcoder <https://www.topcoder.com/community/data-science/data-science-tutorials/`_, a site where you can develop your programming and design skills. They provide a UI to practice coding and to compete in speed and code-quality challenges. It's a fine interface, but I'd rather code in my own environment. I've developed a scaffold that helps me work these problems out on my on machine. A scaffold-ed project has a CMake configuration file, a stubbed class to complete the problem and an executable that drives a series GTest-based tests. The tests match the examples provided in each problem description. Ideally I would create a scraper that would pull all the values down from the site automagically, but for now I populate some of the details manually. Take a look for yourself.
